sentence.Network_en: Somebody took a potshot at him as he drove past.
sentence.Network_cn: 他开车通过的时候，有人向他乱开了一枪。

sentence.Network_en: I took a potshot at the rabbit, but missed.
sentence.Network_cn: 我向兔子胡乱打了一枪, 但是没有射中.

sentence.Network_en: Two influential economists take a potshot at financial policymakers. Why don't their criticisms add up?
sentence.Network_cn: 两位有名经济学家狠恶报复金融政策拟定者. 而他们的批驳为何不恻隐理?

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(P) ... potsherd 陶瓷碎片 potshot 乱射 Pott's disease 卜德氏病.
邮件存档查阅 ... pitfall 陷阱，意料不到 potshot 肆意抨击 slipshod 潦草.
word list 15 flashcards | Quizlet ... potential 潜在的 potshot 盲目射击；肆意抨击 potted 盆栽的；瓶装的.

list.abs: take exception to 对极端地反对take potshots at 对做随意的批评p121.6

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: originally a shot at an animal intended for the pot, i.e. for food, rather than for display (which would require skilled shooting)

means.word_mean: 1. a shot taken at an easy or casual target (as by a pothunter)
2. criticism aimed at an easy target and made without careful consideration;

auth_sentence.content: In a potshot at his larger rival, Justin King, chief executive of Sainsbury's, said: We've clearly outperformed them.
auth_sentence.res_content: In a potshot at his larger rival, Justin King, chief executive of Sainsbury's, said: We've clearly outperformed them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In a potshot at his larger rival, Justin King, chief executive of Sainsbury's, said: We've clearly outperformed them.
